channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped suitcase, 27th June
item.description:
This case came from number 2 porthkerry ave it was outside his gate for a couple of days then he moved it to the corner. he often dumps items like this a few weeks ago it was a chair then some wood , the suitcase was the latest item he dumped and yes it is full
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hook Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike, 27th June
item.description:
This bicycle has been abandoned there for months and it does not allow me and other cyclist to chain the bike securely when we have to go to the near Sainsbury's local. It is an health hazard.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Old Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Blue bins filled with wrong waste therefor not emptied, 27th June
item.description:
Hi, I just received a ‘problem fixed’ notification that the blue bins I reported being overfilled with wrong waste by neighbours and passers by . BUT the problem is not fixed and it is getting worse as the foxes and other animals has started spreading the rubbish further afield in the street. Please can you arrange for someone to take the rubbish away. And preferably also take there two blue bins away as well.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 83, Balfour Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dead squirrel squished on the pavement, 27th June
item.description:
A dead squirrel has been squashed on the pavement on Green Lanes on the boundary fence side of Finsbury Park. Sadly its remains have been strewn along the pavement - please can this be collected as a matter of priority for health and safety. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London

item.title: Unable to push the pram, 27th June
item.description:
Vegetation has completely grown over the pathway and I'm unable to push my pram and now having to walk in the road. Full off brambles, thornes and nettles. Please can this get completed as I can see someone else has reported this two weeks ago
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Chelsfield Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: One bike at risk of falling into north circular, another blocking footpath, 27th June
item.description:
Please sort out your geolocking to avoid people abandoning bikes at the Haringey borough border. This morning one bike has been left blocking the footpath and another on the pedestrian island in the North Circular where if the bike falls down it could fall into the flow of fast moving A406 heavy traffic. Apply the geolocking further from the boundary so there is not build up of bikes at the very edge of Haringey. You also have a bike on Station Road N11 which I believe should not be there.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bounds Green Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet
